00017 #include "Track.h"
00018 
00019 #if defined(USE_MIDI)
00020 
00021 class wxDC;
00022 class wxRect;
00023 
00024 class DirManager;
00025 class Alg_seq;   // from "allegro.h"
00026 
00027 class AUDACITY_DLL_API NoteTrack:public Track {
00028  public:
00029    friend class TrackArtist;
00030 
00031    NoteTrack(DirManager * projDirManager);
00032    virtual ~NoteTrack();
00033 
00034    virtual Track *Duplicate();
00035    
00036    virtual int GetKind() const { return Note; } 
00037 
00038    virtual double GetStartTime() { return 0.0; }
00039    virtual double GetEndTime() { return mLen; }
00040 
00041    void DrawLabelControls(wxDC & dc, wxRect & r);
00042    bool LabelClick(wxRect & r, int x, int y, bool right);
00043 
00044    void SetSequence(Alg_seq *seq);
00045    Alg_seq* GetSequence();
00046    void PrintSequence();
00047 
00048    int GetVisibleChannels();
00049 
00050    bool ExportMIDI(wxString f);
00051    bool ExportAllegro(wxString f);
00052 
00053 /* REQUIRES PORTMIDI */
00054 //   int GetLastMidiPosition() const { return mLastMidiPosition; }
00055 //   void SetLastMidiPosition( int position )
00056 //   {
00057 //      mLastMidiPosition = position;
00058 //   }
00059 
00060    // High-level editing
00061    virtual bool Cut  (double t0, double t1, Track **dest);
00062    virtual bool Copy (double t0, double t1, Track **dest);
00063    virtual bool Clear(double t0, double t1);
00064    virtual bool Paste(double t, Track *src);
00065 
00066    int GetBottomNote() const { return mBottomNote; }
00067    void SetBottomNote(int note) 
00068    { 
00069       if (note < 0)
00070          note = 0;
00071       else if (note > 96)
00072          note = 96;
00073 
00074       mBottomNote = note; 
00075    }
00076 
00077    virtual bool HandleXMLTag(const wxChar *tag, const wxChar **attrs);
00078    virtual XMLTagHandler *HandleXMLChild(const wxChar *tag);
00079    virtual void WriteXML(XMLWriter &xmlFile);
00080 
00081  private:
00082    Alg_seq *mSeq; // NULL means no sequence
00083    // when Duplicate() is called, assume that it is to put a copy
00084    // of the track into the undo stack or to redo/copy from the
00085    // stack to the project object. We want copies to the stack
00086    // to be serialized (therefore compact) representations, so
00087    // copy will set mSeq to NULL and serialize to the following
00088    // variables. If this design is correct, the track will be
00089    // duplicated again (in the event of redo) back to the project
00090    // at which point we will unserialize the data back to the
00091    // mSeq variable. (TrackArtist should check to make sure this
00092    // flip-flop from mSeq to mSerializationBuffer happened an
00093    // even number of times, otherwise mSeq will be NULL).
00094    char *mSerializationBuffer; // NULL means no buffer
00095    long mSerializationLength;
00096    double mLen;
00097 
00098    DirManager *mDirManager;
00099 
00100    int mBottomNote;
00101 
00102    int mVisibleChannels;
00103    int mLastMidiPosition;
00104 };
00105 
00106 #endif // USE_MIDI

00108 #endif
